intro: Malesherbia lirana var. subglabrifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved malesherbia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
